messages.message:
I know this might be changing, but in pre-prod right now my config panel looks like this. Its quite hard to quickly understand what I can edit and what I can’t. Theres quite a lot going on here. Do we have a wider redesign of this element in the pipeline?

@alagu
this is already changing -- you only see this since you have the datatype feature turned on

i've seen this discussion on prompt / semantic name being raised in many different slack threads tagging many different people that it's hard to keep track; please work with @lydia @hannah directly on this
Cool. Yeah this isn’t about the semantic name specifically, more that the design makes the outputs look like inputs.
like the boarder around the list
Yeah thats the main thing making this hard here, but generally this component is becoming very cluttered.

ah i see -- i agree, i actually don't know if design has worked on this. @Serena @Natasha can you take a look? I also don't think the boarder around the list is necessary... removing that might just solve the problem
Thanks, I think we need something to break up each ‘line’ - like banded rows and more spacing. And some other input type vs horizontal inputs (text, selects) a bit like this screenshot:
In pre-prod I can see there are field labels, which helps slightly

+1 I agree with this feedback. I believe Natasha (or Jianqi?) is redesigning the field editing pane. We should take this feedback into account as well (it's hard to distinguish the model result from the input boxes, especially for tables and lists)
I believe we're already planning to move Clean out to a separate section, so that should already add more visual separation between the prompt, results and clean lines

Great, I know we’d also discussed if clean should stay being named clean or not. We actually use it quite a lot now for narrowing down what the extraction prompt got back for us from the document. So we use it just as much for refinement as we do for cleaning now.
heard! should already be better in the redesign we're working on, but i'll be sure to take a closer look at the results formatting
when is a list visually formatted like bullet points vs like a table?

@Natasha I think it depends what you ask the model for. If you don’t use the list feature and ask for a list you get it back as bullets. If you use the list feature you get it back as a table with one column
note that the model can return something in list/table form even if not explicitly asked to, and even if it's not the datatype
